medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 4 months before presentation after a routine jog, with 'pounding' in the chest, nausea, and diaphoresis lasting 40 minutes. Symptoms recurred on the day before transfer to the hospital during a skiing trip, with fatigue followed by palpitations, dyspnea, and weakness, which improved after rest. Later that evening, acute nausea, emesis, and chest pain occurred, leading to emergency care.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of thyroid cancer treated with thyroidectomy and radioactive iodine ablation. Past episode of exercise-related symptoms with elevated troponin levels.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandfather died from myocardial infarction at 60 years of age; father had an aortic-valve replacement; mother had lung cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Employed in health care, married, with one healthy daughter. Non-smoker, does not consume alcohol or use illicit drugs.
